bdi4jade.plan

Class AbstractPlan

  • java.lang.Object
    • bdi4jade.core.MetadataElementImpl
      • bdi4jade.plan.AbstractPlan
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MetadataElement, Plan
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultPlan

    public abstract class AbstractPlan
extends MetadataElementImpl
implements Plan
    This class represents the plan abstraction, being an abstract implementation of the Plan interface.
    Author:
    Ingrid Nunes

      • canAchieve

        public boolean canAchieve(Goal goal)
        Verifies if a given goal can be achieved by this plan. It first checks if the current context is applicable by invoking the isContextApplicable(Goal) method. If so, when the goal is a MessageGoal, it invokes the method canProcess(ACLMessage). Otherwise, it checks if the class of this goal is in the goal set of this plan.
        Specified by:
        canAchieve in interface Plan
        Parameters:
        goal - the goal to be verified.
        Returns:
        true if the given goal can be achieved by this plan, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Plan.canAchieve(Goal)

      • canProcess

        public boolean canProcess(jade.lang.acl.ACLMessage message)
        Verifies if the message matches with any of the message templates of this plan.
        Specified by:
        canProcess in interface Plan
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if this plan can process the message, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Plan.canProcess(ACLMessage)

      • initGoalTemplates

        protected void initGoalTemplates()
        This method is invoked in the Plan constructor. It is responsible for initializing the goal templates that this plan can achieve. The method should be overridden by subclasses.

      • initMessageTemplates

        protected void initMessageTemplates()
        This method is invoked in the Plan constructor. It is responsible for initializing the message templates that this plan can process. The method should be overridden by subclasses.

      • isContextApplicable

        public boolean isContextApplicable(Goal goal)
        Verifies that this plan can be executed in the current context and a given goal. The method should be overridden by subclasses, this implementation returns always true.
        Specified by:
        isContextApplicable in interface Plan
        Parameters:
        goal - the goal to be achieved whose conditions may be tested to verify the applicability of this plan.
        Returns:
        true.
        See Also:
        Plan.isContextApplicable(Goal)
